camel.source.endpoint.configurationUri.name: camel.source.endpoint.configurationUri
camel.source.endpoint.configurationUri.description: URI pointing to the Ehcache XML configuration file's location

camel.source.endpoint.createCacheIfNotEx.name: camel.source.endpoint.createCacheIfNotExist
camel.source.endpoint.createCacheIfNotEx.description: Configure if a cache need to be created if it does exist or can't be pre-configured.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.eventFiring.name: camel.source.endpoint.eventFiring
camel.source.endpoint.eventFiring.description: Set the delivery mode (synchronous, asynchronous) One of: [ASYNCHRONOUS] [SYNCHRONOUS]

camel.source.endpoint.eventOrdering.name: camel.source.endpoint.eventOrdering
camel.source.endpoint.eventOrdering.description: Set the delivery mode (ordered, unordered) One of: [UNORDERED] [ORDERED]

camel.source.endpoint.eventTypes.name: camel.source.endpoint.eventTypes
camel.source.endpoint.eventTypes.description: Set the type of events to listen for (EVICTED,EXPIRED,REMOVED,CREATED,UPDATED). You can specify multiple entries separated by comma. One of: [EVICTED] [EXPIRED] [REMOVED] [CREATED] [UPDATED]

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.configuration.name: camel.source.endpoint.configuration
camel.source.endpoint.configuration.description: The default cache configuration to be used to create caches.

camel.source.endpoint.configurations.name: camel.source.endpoint.configurations
camel.source.endpoint.configurations.description: A map of cache configuration to be used to create caches.

camel.source.endpoint.keyType.name: camel.source.endpoint.keyType
camel.source.endpoint.keyType.description: The cache key type, default java.lang.Object

camel.source.endpoint.valueType.name: camel.source.endpoint.valueType
camel.source.endpoint.valueType.description: The cache value type, default java.lang.Object

camel.component.ehcache.configurationUri.name: camel.component.ehcache.configurationUri
camel.component.ehcache.configurationUri.description: URI pointing to the Ehcache XML configuration file's location

camel.component.ehcache.createCacheIfNot.name: camel.component.ehcache.createCacheIfNotExist
camel.component.ehcache.createCacheIfNot.description: Configure if a cache need to be created if it does exist or can't be pre-configured.

camel.component.ehcache.bridgeErrorHandl.name: camel.component.ehcache.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.ehcache.bridgeErrorHandl.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.ehcache.eventFiring.name: camel.component.ehcache.eventFiring
camel.component.ehcache.eventFiring.description: Set the delivery mode (synchronous, asynchronous) One of: [ASYNCHRONOUS] [SYNCHRONOUS]

camel.component.ehcache.eventOrdering.name: camel.component.ehcache.eventOrdering
camel.component.ehcache.eventOrdering.description: Set the delivery mode (ordered, unordered) One of: [UNORDERED] [ORDERED]

camel.component.ehcache.eventTypes.name: camel.component.ehcache.eventTypes
camel.component.ehcache.eventTypes.description: Set the type of events to listen for (EVICTED,EXPIRED,REMOVED,CREATED,UPDATED). You can specify multiple entries separated by comma. One of: [EVICTED] [EXPIRED] [REMOVED] [CREATED] [UPDATED]

camel.component.ehcache.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.ehcache.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.ehcache.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.ehcache.configuration.name: camel.component.ehcache.configuration
camel.component.ehcache.configuration.description: The default cache configuration to be used to create caches.

camel.component.ehcache.configurations.name: camel.component.ehcache.configurations
camel.component.ehcache.configurations.description: A map of cache configuration to be used to create caches.

camel.component.ehcache.keyType.name: camel.component.ehcache.keyType
camel.component.ehcache.keyType.description: The cache key type, default java.lang.Object

camel.component.ehcache.valueType.name: camel.component.ehcache.valueType
camel.component.ehcache.valueType.description: The cache value type, default java.lang.Object
